attributes.action: Reverse the Decision to Scrap the Gender Recognition Act Consultation Results
attributes.additional_details:
Self-ID, access to healthcare and reducing the time for trans people to access care that allows them to begin their transition needs to be improved.
You held the consultation (2018) and got your results. You MUST follow up on them. Our trans siblings are one of the most vulnerable groups in modern society and face discrimination and often violence at a disproportionate rate.  We need you to carry out the results and apply the new guidelines from the consultation like you promised you would!
attributes.background:
The government held a consultation regarding the Gender Recognition Act, asking the general public their opinion on changes to the GRA to improve trans lives. 
More than 100,000 responses were given, overwhelmingly in favour of these changes.
Trans lives will be lost if these changes aren't made.

rejection.details:
Reform the Gender Recognition Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327108

Uphold current legal protections for transgender individuals and under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318175

Do not ban gender transition treatments for under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318025

Add gender identity to the characteristics protected under the Equality Act 2010:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301138

Require schools and colleges to have gender neutral toilets:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302997

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324934

Allow for a gender neutral option on a passport, such as an "X":
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301083
